author: mohseng
content: Are there L2 standards?  There are many L2 implementations and deployed systems but they generally don't talk to each other.  Perhaps we should have standards?

author: mohseng
content: Even in that case, still need liquidity providers, but interoperability gets much more straightforward.

author: mohseng
content: I imagine solutions such as starkware are effectively standards.  Are there more examples?

author: mohseng
content: Then we'll need adaptors for inter-standard interoperability

author: fliguy.eth
content: There are bridging solutions in the works, here is one: https://connext.network/ also I use zapper which looks to be adding it: https://zapper.fi/bridge

author: fliguy.eth
content: also someone has thrown up an implementation of it, not sure if you can trust it or not https://www.xpollinate.io/ but enabled polygon <-> xdai <-> BSC at the moment, not really sure if this is the appropriate channel for this, probably off topic, feel like there should be a group for this.

author: mohseng
content: Zapper bridge I didn't know.  Thanks.

author: mohseng
content: these are inter-chain interoperability bridges.  I am talking about between different eth L2s

author: mohseng
content: say I want to send eth from account on deversifi to my account on loopring.  can't do it now.  But if there was an adaptor .. I could do that.   Even swapping could be enabled if enough liquidity was present in an AMM-fashion.  In order to build the adaptor, we will need standards first.

author: pietjepuk
content: I don't think it makes much sense to develop standards in this still very emergent field with plenty of unknowns. Let things crystallize for a bit, and then see what's what.

author: mohseng
content: it's fair point.  But we are getting there I think faster than we can imagine.  It will soon be a spaghetti of useless L2s

author: trent_vanepps
content: connext will allow this

author: mohseng
content: they are an adapter that connect two stovepipe implementations.  For every new L2 out there, they'll need at least some glue code to make the adapter work.  It's not a sustainable solution long term.

author: mohseng
content: Can we have a channel for L2 research?

author: mohseng
content: or ETH2 standards

author: .vbuterin
content:
> 1. inclusion delay reward removed, with only attestations included in the next block being counted

Not quite. Rather, the inclusion delay reward is being simplified; there's now rewards for being "very timely" (within 1 slot) and "timely" (within 5 slots). There's no more `1/delay` reward

author: .vbuterin
content:
> 2. proportion of total per-epoch reward allocated to block proposer increased from 1/32 to 1/8

That sounds right. I think it was intended to be 1/8 all along actually ðŸ˜†

author: .vbuterin
content: > 3. overall per-epoch max issuance unchanged, so the source/target/head rewards will change to keep this invariant

author: .vbuterin
content: correct

author: .vbuterin
content: Well, technically, issuance is increased very slightly, because before there were some math errors that caused the actual maximum reward to be slightly *less* than the base-reward-based amount

author: .vbuterin
content: And Altair fixes those errors
